text: if you are MSG sensitive stay clear of this place. I haven't been here in 2 + years ever since my last experience.  like most reviews the pizza is so so...more along the lines of grocery store pizza....the music is wonderful. Like a previous poster said the ordering process and the lack of credit card acceptance (or lack thereof)is a huge drawback
They do not except cash. They don't have waiters. They don't even give free refills on soda. I will. Ever come back here again. Entertainment was neat.

If you go for the pizza you're doing it wrong.  It's not very good.  1 or 2 star pizza at a five star place.  But sub par pizza is still pizza so it ain't all bad.  We got our food really quick and stayed for about an hour an half to watch some kind of mad genius play something that looked liked the cab on an old steam powered locomotive!  He controlled a little mechanical bird that chirped notes to certain songs from that thing!  The future has truly arrived!  Do you hear me?  The future!!!!!

This place has a very unique atmosphere, with a live organist playing all kinds of crazy instruments hooked up to the stage organ and taking very limited requests. This is primarily a pizza place with similar sides, but nothing there is good except the beer. I personally had a bad pizza experience there and now refer to this place strictly as "The Organ Stopper". Bring kids up to ages 8 or 9, but beyond that they will probably get bored or annoyed fast, unless they are very musically-minded or have an organ-playing scholarship on the horizon. For adults, bring a DD and knock back a pitcher or two to make your time worth it.

Coolest and most entertaining pizza place I've ever been to! The whole place is like one big musical instrument. The organ player takes requests and can play anything you throw at him. The pizza isn't bad either and they also have a gluten free option.
I am thinking people are writing reviews for the atmosphere and not the food.  The food is not good.  You go for the adventure of it but not the food.
If you're looking for some good old vintage music, this is the place!  Not many organs like this left.  Pizza is average, but that's not the point.  Its all about the organ music!
Simply put the organists are good...REALLY good.  Food isn't great but it's still good.  Wonderful family experience.  I will return!
Dirty ice. Apperently roaches near drink station in kitchen
Horrible. Loud and employees are lazy and chatting instead of working on our pizza which took forever to get. I don't recommend going here at all.

As everyone has said food is soso but the do have to pump it out fast to deal with the crowds. The show is cool mostly an older crowd it was for my grandmothers birthday. It's funny to watch people try to talk over the music looks like everyone is going in for a awkward kiss. Overall it's a ok place with the fam

OMG    This place is a shit show. 16,00 grandmas and grandpas with grandkids in tow sitting middle school cafeteria style to eat pizza and watch a 3 story organ being played by a man in a black suit.   First act is for the kids. He starts with Disney classics and ends with a spirit lifting collection of American tunes. All the elders stand and applaud while the American flag is lowered and bubbles float from the rafters.   Intermission: Old lady in front of me falls off her bench and almost puts her head through the drywall. Old lady adjacent me spills her drink on my feet. 6 year old children run around yielding iPhones and iPod touches, taking videos to upload to their baby Facebook accounts.   In the second act shit gets real. Star Wars, the Beatles, and Freddy Mercury. By this time the 30-something's have finished a couple pitchers of beer and are screaming the words to Bohemian Rhapsody. The old people are confused, yelling to one another "is this Les Miserables??!". At the climax of We Are The Champions all the lights turn on and bubbles again pour from the ceiling. At this point you can look around the crowd only to find out there isn't 16,000 people. There's 17,000.   Birthday requests are sent up on paper slips and the organist exalts praise to those  lucky enough to spend their B-Days in such an establishment. If your sad to leave don't worry, you can buy CDs in the gift shop.   The pizza wasn't bad. Good fluffy crust.

The music is definitely the reason why I would go back. However, the pizza is not something they specialize in. Tasted like frozen pizza. I went on a Sunday night and had no problem finding a seat. Make sure to bring CASH or be forced to use their ATM. Fun music, subpar food.

Can't believe we drive 40 miles for this place. What a joke! They only take cash or check, come-on in 2012, pay the merchant fee and get a credit card machine. Then you have to separately order and pay for food and drink. Yes that's right, go stand in two different lines. No refills on soft drinks, horrible beer selection and the worst BBQ chicken pizza I've had. I didn't know you could screw that up. We came, we tried, we won't be doing it again!

Coming from Los Angeles... you don't get that kind of spectacle.  Especially while you're just looking to grab some pizza and a beer.  We get chuck e. cheese... not a grand organ orchestrated by the organ master!  Request "The Choo Choo train" or something like that.  The whole place seems to come alive.  Man, old people in AZ know how to have fun!  I didn't have much time in AZ, but this stop was definitely the highlight of my trip.  I'll definitely be back someday.

Overall a very good experience. Pizza is 7.5/10, salad bar 8/10... The organ music/display really is spectacular...particularly the first time you see it 10/10. ...it is quite odd/strange that they don't accept credit cards...

For the kids, this is an excellent place to be.  With pizza, fun organ music, video games... this has a lot of help to make a great night for the family.  As for the pizza, I am from New Jersey; that should be enough for anyone to understand.
the food wasn't very good, and the organ player didn't seem to know any of the songs we requested.
Great food, excellent service, and an all around great place to take the family.  We went with a family of 12, and finding a seat together was a little hard since this place is very popular.
Awesome pizza! Music was so cool too! Great for all ages! He accepts requests to plus birthday announcements!  Accepts only $ or checks!

I recently moved back to the valley and the pizza has improved. The sauce, toppings, and crust are all high quality and fresh. Organ Stop only gets better.  I love the music and it a great family friendly place to eat.  My daughter gets so excited when they play her request.  Lew Williams, the organist we saw on a Thursday night even played Stairway to Heaven on the organ! Wow.  I don't know if they still have classical concerts but I hope they do.
A slightly upgraded version of chuck e cheese's, but with worse pizza (if that's possible) and a real person instead of animatronic rodents performing the "entertainment."
Impressive talent at that organ! Amazing visuals, sound, and history in one building. Pizza wasn't too bad either. :)

Chuck E Cheese for retirees.  Don't take offense if you are a retiree because I am getting pretty close to that myself, I just thought that the crowd would be much younger. I was astounded at the sheer volume that place does on a weekend as the place was huge, people were packed in like sardines, I felt like I was at a KISS concert.  We had the kids with us and so no alcohol consumtion was possible....that might have helped.  Once we found a seat with aisleways that were not large enough to sit down without getting up every five seconds to let someone through, I had a chance to look around and was impressed with the building, which is the organ. Very cool ,thats why the two  stars.  Past the organ and the show, the place was a tad annoying starting with the fact that they only took cash and checks chiseled on stone tablets like the flintstones. I got in the long line to buy the pizza with the one check my honey gave me and then found out that to order drinks, I needed to get cash out of the ATM in order to get in a second long line to buy drinks.  Food was edible...not good, not the worst. Price was actually not bad, but keep in mind we did not drink.  I think next time I will just get some Totinos Party Pizzas, tune in the Lawrence Welk show and sit 6 people at a card table and the effect will be similar.  I would go back for the organ during the summer, on a week day, when they first open. I think if the crowd was smaller it would still be a cool place to take the kids.

Food....great pizza, excellent salad bar.  Ambiance....this is the best value in all of Arizona. The show is amazing. I have never seen anyone leave this place dissatisfied.   Staff.....ok.  Verdict.......EAT HERE!!! Take your out of town guests here. From kids to elderly everyone enjoys this place...good family entertainment.

Visited on 3/13/15 This is a real fun place. We bring everybody new to AZ here. The organ is very  unique. The pizza is affordable and taste good. If it was excellent pizza I would give 5 stars. Seating can be hard to find during the snow bird peak dinner times. I prefer to sit in the balcony so I see the organist. There is a salad bar and Ice cream.  Bring CASH. We always have a really good time.

This place really is quite special. It's a natural tourist trap, so expect to see plenty of pasty, obnoxious Canadians and so forth, but from what I hear it is a sort of local landmark.   I went for my birthday this year at the recommendation of a few work friends, and I had an incredible time. The pizza gets alot of flack, apparently, but I enjoyed it just fine. It's not likely to be mistaken for gourmet brick-oven pizza that snobs in Sedona eat, but it's still rather good from what I remember.  The organ was incredible. Gigantic. Played by a really good musician. The song selection is pretty universal, showtunes and the like, but just seeing the thing in action is remarkable. I highly recommend it. Now stop bashing the pizza!

They only accept cash and the layout is terrible. You have to purchase the pizza separately from the drinks, and there is an ATM but charges a fee to use. No signs advertising that they only accept cash or check either, restrooms were decent

Took my kids and their families to Organ Stop Pizza last Saturday.  Initially, I wasn't impressed with the service behind the counter or that they don't take debit/credit cards.  You also pay for food and drinks at separate counters...what?  I bought a salad bar but can only go through once...what? However, the entertainment was fun for all.  Cost is OK, food is OK. Service is average. Consideration of the needs of customers is below average (debit/credit not allowed), Entertainment is 5 starts for sure.  Overall, the kids loved it and had a enjoyable time.  At times, it was VERY loud but certainly entertaining.  We would go back.  Mainly for the entertainment and how much the kids enjoyed it.
My family always has fun when we come here, pizza is ok, appetizers are better and desert is good! The entertainment is always fantastic, the downside...cash only

This place is probably more of an event than an everyday place.  The food is pretty decent. Pizza is good nothing special.  Garlic bread is ok as is the salad bar.  They do not take CC so make sure you have cash on hand although they do have an ATM on premise.   What makes this place special is the Organ. Go on the website to read about the history of this 1920's treasure.  With over 6000 pipes my kids are completely in awe of the sound that is produced.  Take your kids and friends they will love it.

Love, love, love this place! Been a regular for years.  Kinda over the Christmas in July music theme, (totally love the partnership with St. Mary's food bank).  Was pleasantly surprised, this organist didnt play ALL Christmas music, wish he wouldnt have been in such a rush though.  Great fun for kids and adults!

We heard about this place mainly regarding the huge organ so while in the area we wanted to have the experience  We found the pizza below par, and over priced, with the entertainment worthy of the visit.    The three star is a combo of a five for the uniqueness of the entertainment and a 1.5 for the food.    As other reviews this place is noisy full of kids and seniors.    If I return I will avoid the pizza hoping the salad bar is more worthy.

This is a great, unique, original place.  My family loves it.  The truth is, if you read the reviews, they are all spot on in one way or another.  Yes, its cash only.....   yes, they make you stand in a second line to buy drinks, and salad, and ice cream.  yes, the pizza is not drawing Oprah Winfrey to it to declare it the best pizza in America.    BUT....  This is the most unique thing you will ever see.  The food is good enough, and priced about what you would expect.  In fact, I think the quality has actually gone up over the years, but pizza is like coffee - snobs abound speculating what makes a pizza great.  At the end of the day, this pizza is pretty good for the family.  No one complains, everyone eats full amounts.  But unlike other "unique" places that are "unique" because they have funny pictures of people urinating in the bathroom, or kayaks on the walls or whatever, this actually has an oddly unique entertainment concept.    We have tried it several ways, and do note, if you have not been, there is a method to the madness - if you swim with the fish, its far easier than swimming against the school.  What I mean by that is this:  The place gets PACKED.  When it opens there is a HUGE amount of people outside.  But their business goes in waves.  All the people crowd in, and order pizza at the same time, get drinks at the same time, sit at the same time, and for all practical purposes, leave at the same time.  The first "Set" is all old folks and families with tiny kids.  If you go with this crowd, get there 15 mins before it opens and don't freak when you are in a big line - you will get the seats you want.    But, the interesting thing, is that if you go later in the evening, at the end of each set, a large group of people will leave all at once.  This ends up being the best time to go, because there are no lines, and you get great seats.   It's inevitable, if its packed, wait 3o minutes and half the crowd will leave, all at once!    The organ itself is massive, and the instruments littered all over the roof, walls and back of the restaurant are controlled in time with the music.  In many cases, you can't really figure out which pipes are playing, but "big" songs like ITS A SMALL WORLD, and STAR WARS seem to use every instrument and its amazing.  Kids love it, old folks love it, everyone loves it.  (fair warning, I was one of those people that grew up with this place as a kid, in the 1970's.....  LOTS of great memories here, and my kids get the same experience that I had back then - it hasn't changed that much).    Later in the evening, things like the Canadian Flag descend and the Canada anthem plays, with lots of people getting up and singing and crying, followed by the Star Spangled Banner and Old Glory, Followed by Mickey Mouse Club flag, etc.  This is the kind of place, that you better stand and put your hand over your heart or you WILL get a WW2 Vet punching your jaw.  We bring all sorts of family and visitors here.  Do we bring them to show them that we have found the worlds best Pizza?  No.  A great Micro Brew selection?  oh no....  The best music you ever heard?  No (things played on an organ sound different).  But we take them here because when you add up all the small parts, its the most unique thing you have ever witnessed.  It comes off as one of those little niche concepts that some crazy inventor came up with that may work no where else but on this street corner.  Believe it, people come here to celebrate 50 yr wedding anniversaries and stuff - they read them out loud and its amazing.  This place, with all its random uniqueness is part of the culture of Phoenix and Arizona - which, is why it lands on lists for good dating experiences, etc.  If you propose to your future wife here, yes, you have no taste, but bring your kids here?  Then you are a cool dad! :-)
My family and I love going to organ stop pizza. The kids look forward to requesting and seeing the cats. Everyone there is so nice. Pizza and ice cream are great!

The pizza is ok, but you don't come for that. You come for the experience.  However, small children and teens may not like it, especially on nights where there's lots of senior citizens since they'll flood the suggestion box with tunes from 40-60 years ago, and kids who were born in the last 20 years will quickly get bored, since they won't recognize any of the songs.

Organ Stop is a family favorite! I ate there tonight for the first time in a few years and it as just as good as I remembered. The pizza is delicious and the atmosphere is so fun! A small pizza more than filled me up and it wasn't very expensive. It is a little loud while the organ is playing but that's why you come. They only miss out on getting 5 stars because of the cash only requirement. I love organ stop!

Having read many of the reviews, I expected to enjoy the show and tolerate the food.  Our group was pleasantly surprised to enjoy both the pizza and salad bar as well as some ice cream for dessert..  While I didn't particularly love the music itself, the performance was excellent.  I loved watching the various parts of the organ as it was played, we are looking forward to returning with visiting friends.

This is such a fun place to eat!  I love that this sort of entertainment still exists... I have seen several organists over the years and each one delivered a good experience.  They are always willing to play requests, even when customers ask for the same songs over and over- the musicians take that sort of monotony with grace, even though they must get tired of it.  The food is not amazing, but I have also never been disappointed.  The pizza is as good as any delivery restaurant, if not better.  Add garlic bread and ice cream for dessert, and we always leave happy.  The logistics are a bit unexpected- cash is required and the drink line is separate from the food order line.  But, to me that just adds to the old-school charm.

We love this place! The Wurlitzer is amazing and it even has dancing cats, a quacking duck and bubbles! The pizza is just good but the entertainment value is priceless... Especially when kids or Mom and Dad start dancing. We like to sit upstairs for the viewing.

My brother would not stop talking about this place. Finally he decided I had to go for my birthday. Wasn't sure if that was the best idea but I trusted my brother anyway. This was a few years ago mind you so I was turning 22 at the time. I wouldn't recommend this place to just adults but it is a family eatery for sure. The food was decent but what you really go there for the ambiance. The entire building is a HUGE instrument and one man controls them all. He does take requests and my brother graciously requested for him to play Happy Birthday for me as well as a Star Wars AND a Disney montage of songs....yes they do montages. It brought me to tears! It was so wonderful! Great for birthday parties because you can bring your own cake and the food is decent and cheap! I would probably compare the pizza to Peter Piper's pizza.

I cannot give any restaurant that is solely centered around ORGAN music less than 5 stars.  The pizza: to be honest, it's not that good. But if you're really hungry, it's actually kinda good. Just drench those little slices in ranch and peppers and life is good.   The beer: wait... There's beer here?!?! Heck yeah! At $3 a pint and $8 pitchers, not too shabby. Yeah they're all domestic, but hey, now you can drink a beer while you listen to your organ music.   The organ: oh the organ. Literally sweet music to my ears. And they take requests?! Ah yeah!!! Gimme summa dat "Play That Funky Music" immediately followed by "Amazing Grace." Top 40 ain't got nothing!  The giant disco ball: yeah it's a thing here.   You might be surrounded by 70-something's and children under 5, but if you want a really 1970-chic spot to listen to organ, eat mediocre pizza, and drink domestic beer, look no further. It might be the only place in the entire universe where all of these worlds will converge.

I wish I could give a 4.5. The food is great, the organ is fun (especially for kids) but everything is pretty outdated. If they update the area (the cups reminded me of the ones at buffets about 25 years ago) and take credit cards then it's a solid 5.

Always a hit with my out-of-town visitors. The musical show always impresses! I like their pizza. The crust is crispy but easy to chew. It comes out of the ovens in about 10 minutes. When you realize you're getting a theater experience plus dinner, the prices are reasonable.  $20 buys dinner and drinks for 2, with a couple of dollars left to tip the performers. The organists are very professional.  Atmosphere is very casual, like a German beer hall.
This place is an absolute disgrace to our nation. They play the Canadian anthem before the American national anthem.

Come for the entertainment and enjoy the food. Everyone in my family loved our experience. Do yourself a favor and request The Phantom Of The Opera. Take note: they do not accept credit or debit cards. There is a ATM in the lobby.

Honestly, the pizza was average (little caesars level) and the service is a little odd.  Order and pay for your pizza at this cashier.....can i add a drink....oh thats the 2nd line where you order and pay for any drinks.  All that said.....the entertainment is AWSOME!!  When i heard of it, i thought "an organ....really....you gotta be kidding me, not interested".  Then i went and saw.....freakin awesome.  The kids were mesmerized!!

I am on a staycation with my wife and 3 of my 4 kids. We were in mesa pondering dinner when I had an aha moment. No not the lame band from the 80s. I remembered Organ Stop Pizza. Neither my wife nor I had been there in years. The pizza was adequate. It was very similar to Peter Piper. The sodas were a bummer. I paid for soda refills. The real reason to be here is the show. The show is fantastic!!!! There is so much to listen to and see. The music tends to be Disney and classical. My boys love giving their song suggestions. It was a wonderful night that I would suggest to everyone. We will be back.

Hooooleee what the H-E-double hockey sticks did I just walk into? That's when it clicked! All those mid-west license plates in the parking lot as I was walking into Organ Stop! My gob was agape from the moment I stepped through the doors. This place looks like how I imagine the mid-west would taste, big and bland. I mean I haven't seen a greater concentration of mid-westerns in the metro area outside of Sun City or Mill Ave in Tempe during football season. I mean it is definitely something I am... I mean... I uhhh... I don't regret going there. I didn't get the poops from the food or anything like that. So the pizza... I've had better frozen pizzas than what Organ Stop had to offer that hour or so. But hey! they have free refills on soda so that is worth a star.   Organ Stop is big and loud and there are kiddos running around having fun dropping off music requests with crossed-fingers but, the most striking thing about this place is its organ. *que obvious innuendos* Organ Stop is definitely well-endowed. It is a mighty organ. You can't miss it. It makes up an entire (2-story) wall and then spills out onto the other walls. It is really the only reason to go there. However, while I don't want to ever go there again, it does look like it's kind of fun for little humans whose brains are still developing (you can request music for the organist to play) as well as people who like big organs.  tee ell; dee arr: go for the organ, leave for the pizza.

Went there tonight with my friend and her two kids. The kids and I had a large pepperoni pizza that I thought was pretty darn good. My friend has spaghetti and she said is was very good.  So is this gourmet? Did we expect gourmet? Of course not, what we got was pretty good food and a lot of fun. The kids thought the music was a blast.  They sang along with the Christmas songs and smiled the whole time. A lot of people on Yelp are complaining because the place only takes cash.  Well, this place has a feel from years gone past with the music and the flavor of the old times. Everything was cash years ago, quit complaining and pay as you eat, don't pay later with interest added on. The evening was a fun time for all of us and the kids want to come back again.

Couldn't ask for a better night of really great Pizza, coupled with outstanding and professional entertainment brought to us by a superb and accomplished Organist who's versatility on a  Concert Organ was displayed amazingly, and spectacularly.   I was so taken up by his keyboard artistry that even long after I had finished my Pizza, I didn't want to leave.    He was just fascinating, not to mention the delicious Pizza.

So the pizza is fine and the entertainment fun and different but bring your cash cuz they don't take Visa... MasterCard...Discover...or AmEx... Really? I just think that's a sign a business is out to serve themselves and not their customers. Also, stand in line, order and pay for your pizza at one counter. Then go stand in another line and order and pay for your drinks. No refills on soda so if you want a refill go stand in line again and pay for a refill. Definitely flow issues at this place.

Stopped here on a recent vacation to Arizona.  It's one of the places you need to stop at while you're there.  A huge pipe organ playing all kinds of tunes.  The pizza was pretty good but it's more about the experience.  There's two levels so you can sit upstairs and overlook the stage or sit on the ground floor.  Worth a visit if you're in the area.

Heard about this place through co-workers. It's a nice place to bring my mother when she visits... But I wouldn't return. The line to order was long, the drink line was unorganized, then it took forever to find a clean seat! Then we couldn't even see the man playing.... It's just not worth the hassle. The pizza wasn't bad--- but I would rather make my own.

Completely unaware of its reputation, I came here with my wife's family for a family gathering.  Well, they couldn't have picked a worse place for "family gathering."  The place is loud (you have to shout to each other to carry a conversation), jam packed (we had to sit in tables in the opposite corners of the place), and the pizza is horrible (more on that soon).  To me, the only positive thing of the place is the organ music.  I guess that's how they earn their keep and draw the large crowd.  They take crowd requests, and the organist actually is quite good.  But that's about the only good thing of the whole experience.  As soon as we walked in, a huge sign greeted us "Cash or checks only, no credit or debit cards."  What era are we in, 1940's?  In this day and age, the only places that accept cash only are those taking tax advantages.  And the pizza.  Tasted like cardboard with cheese and not-so-fresh toppings.  Any store-bought frozen pizza would have tasted better.  And then they cheated on the toppings too.  We ordered a 2-topping pie, only to see the number of pepperoni on ours being about half of that of a 1-topping pepperoni pizza.  Hello?  I paid for 2 toppings, not 2 different toppings splitting half-n-half.  Honestly, I really don't know how other reviewers think their pizza is even "ok."  To this day, I could not believe anyone could ruin pizzas this badly.  Overall, the place has the ambience of a German beer hall during Oktoberfest.  Organ playing was kinda cool, and I can see how this is a "family place" cuz kids generally would like the music.  But the food is terrible.  If you want to come here, eat somewhere else first (get a hot dog from the gas stations nearby or something), then come enjoy the organ with ice cream.  But then again, if they screw up pizzas so badly, maybe you shouldn't brave the ice cream either.

It felt like Vegas. Please note, I like Vegas. If you don't like loud noises and bright, flashing lights in the dark, this isn't for you.  Lots of stimulation of the senses. The decorations are cool too. The giant organ is connected to the decor. Even the ceiling fans are on a cool mechanical system.  The pizza was good. Not too thick, not too thin. I only got pepperoni, but would like to try additional toppings.  It was fun to dance along to the music while eating. I can't wait to go back!

The pros - The organ and the organ player, who was really good.  It was a unique experience. The cons - everything else.  Wait in one line to order your food.  Wait in another line to order your drinks.  Then try to find a seat.  We went at 6 on a week night and the place was packed.  And I didn't want to sit at a table with people that I didn't know.  This was our date night, and that's really weird.  Found a spot at the end of a table upstairs that was somewhat clean and not completely full, but still felt like a sardine in a can.  And from there, couldn't see the organ at all.  Screaming kid at the table behind us was really annoying, but I guess the parents thought it was noisy enough here that it was ok to just let her scream.  Got our food which was one step up from frozen pizza.  Husband wanted another drink, but not badly enough to climb over a bunch of people and wait in line again.  Probably an ok spot for a big family or school group or something, but not so much for a party of two.

We've been wanting to come here for a long time since its advertised as the best family friendly restaurant in the valley. We had a decent time, but they do not take credit cards which was a problem since not everyone brought cash. You also must wait in line for food, beverages, and dessert seperately! And carry it possibly upstairs yourself. The food was good, but it is so loud it was very difficult to hold a conversation. Our kids (2 boys) didn't appreciate the organ music, but I thought it was nice, different.

Crass incongruity at its worst. Or best? Is there a difference? This restaurant features average pizza and a magnificent pipe organ. My parents and I arrived just before the music began, and I was so excited at the prospect of hearing some of my favourite classical pieces. Oh, I was a fool.  The organist played marching band music and doo-wop. It was so loud that my deaf parents shut off their hearing aids. The customers actually interrupted their meals to stand at attention, and then cheered wildly when the organist played "America the Beautiful". My smartass dad asked, "What song is this?" A burly guy with shaved head and shark eyes sitting across from us responded by showing my dad his fist. His entire arm was covered in American flag tattoos.  An ideal place for the very young, very old, deaf, or fanatic.
Great place to take kids.  Been going since I was a kid - pizza is okay and cheap.  Cash only, but they have an ATM on the premises.

Organ stop is listed as a family friendly place this is not true we always go there for family birthday parties for the children.  The children who are all under seven years of age enjoy this we always sit clear to the front where there's an area against the front wall where the children like to get up and dance to the music.  Last night at a two-year-old's birthday party a woman who was sitting in the second-floor got quite upset because our our kids were dancing.  She actually ruined our party by demanding we make our kids sit down.  we left there and found her in front of the place standing on the patio smoking which is against the law you have to be 50 foot from that front door   What an unhappy sour woman.  We won't be back as it was an unnecessary  complaint.

I just returned from a Meet Up at the Organ Stop Pizza.   The line waiting to get into the building was very long, with people jostling each other impatiently. Prices were high for the quality of the food. I ordered a small 'Everything' pizza and small salad. The pizza was mediocre at best. The salad greens were wilted, the toppings were not fresh, and the dressings were warm.  The entertainment was glitzy, and very loud. The room was crowded. The people sitting behind me kept knocking into the bench I was sitting on, slowly pushing me into the table in front of me. I really didn't enjoy it as much as I thought I would.   I would not recommend this place for those who are used to higher end venues, if pizza is even high end, LOL!  If you go, make sure to take cash. They do not take credit or debit cards. They do have an ATM inside the building.

Have you ever felt the sentiment of when something is so bad it actually surpasses its badness and becomes good?  now let me ask you this......have you ever had that feeling where its so bad it becomes good then goes back to bad then meagerly yet triumphantly manages to fall into the GREAT category???   I give you... ORGAN STOP PIZZA!!!!!  Rule #1 You will want to be under the influence of ANYTHING upon entering this establishment.  -TRUST!!! ordering here is a nightmare..it's a really weird system..u may have to barter and/or trade wives or something to get pizza....could be cash only.. idk (or can remember [ I adhere strictly to Rule #1]) but do you really go for the pizza...or the experience-- this word needs to be italicized.  Rule #2 -You must drink alcohol while in this establishment!!! For your own sake! (be surprised they even serve alcohol here!)  Rule #3 - It is encouraged to request crazy-ass songs... "they" (being the crazy exclusive largest organ on earth made of cellophane/cardboard/packing tape illustrious organists) seriously know everything!! They even know Beyonce! for real, I swear one time they played "Crazy In Love".   -Also, you can totally take credit for this, but suggest to your friends a game where your group is versus every other patron/family there and try to totally dominate the request bowl.  here's a hint: suggest- "moon river", anything disney ("under the sea" boasts actual bubbles that float down from the ceiling and land in your pizza), I don't know the name of it but we call it the 'crazy cat song'...it includes a puppet show of 4 janky-azz cats that bop up and down behind the organist....they seriously look like they got the mange. definitely request that one..it WILL get played. in fact that's the only reason we go anymore..for the cats.  -Rule # whatever. sing really loud to annoy the 65+ ...once they leave you will be the only ones there...just like a private show!   -RULE: Don't forget to tip!  *and don't forget to stop at the "gift shop" on your way out!!!

It was okay. I found the organ music to be pretty good, but don't expect to be able to have a conversation with the other people you go with. The pizza is good but not great. It tasted like frozen pizza to me, and it was overpriced for what it was. It was super crowded - I second the suggestion to arrive as soon as they open. I don't think I'll come here again. It wasn't worth the noise and the people. The counter staff also didn't understand English enough to know that I was asking if their iced tea was sweetened or unsweet.   Not going back, I think.

My grandparents figured I'd like this place because I am a musician, and had never been to an organ stop. First of all. The organ is very cool and interesting to watch while eating here... Kids will love it, as well as the older 60+ crowd.  However, the pizza just isn't that good or memorable in any way, you have to pay cash (which is annoying since I don't carry any these days, and wanted a beer), and they've eliminated servers and make you serve yourself like you're at a hot dog stand or something. Not cool. For the prices they charge, I should get a cute waitress, a really good pizza pie, and a charge for another pitcher of beer on my visa.

My family has been going here for 20+years even when they were at their first location. Tonight was the only time I can say I was extremely disapointed. Food always awesome! But the Organist was a jerk and unprofessional. We've always brought our kids year after year and we have kids(2) with Autism. My kids were dancing to the wonderful music and having fun with their cousins. They were a little hyper but I was reminding them to calm down,(part of the Autism behaviors). Honestly they were being kids.  And their were many other kids than just our party enjoying the music and dancing. After one of the songs the Organist calls us out over the intercom and then stared us down. So much for our always kid friendly destination. We've NEVER had this issue before in all the time we've visited. And even the staff was super nice.  Sad to have a musician get a power trip.

This restaurant is a lot of fun! The food is not gourmet, but good. I ordered the large salad bar plate. It was reasonably priced and I piled it up to the sky. My wife ordered the vegetarian pizza and it wasn't bad!  The organist is very talented. He played all kinds of music and took some written requests. The place was packed. We got there a little before 4pm when it opened and stayed for 2 sets.   Check it out. You won't be disappointed!

I really loved this place, maybe I've got an immature palate but I really loved the pizza and the organist was amazing. To be fair, my parents took me here as a kid and maybe for me it's nostalgia but I adored everything about coming here!

Great place!  My family brought me here for the first time and I really enjoyed the atmosphere. The organ player played a variety of classic tunes such as the Star Wars theme.  Lights would flash during the songs, and even bubbles rained down during a Little Mermaid song.  The pizza itself was pretty tasty.  Fortunately, they had plenty of gluten free options.  It can get a bit crowded and a bit noisy, but it's the most entertaining pizza joint I've been to.
Great pizza and the worlds biggest Wurlitzer! What more do you really need? Check out this musical oasis in the desert for a step back in time.  ***CASH ONLY***

If you are in the Phoenix, Arizona area, specifically Mesa, you should definitely check this place out! What's better than listening to a talented organist play well known tunes on a ginormous organ (the world's largest Wurlitzer BTW) with a multitude of side instruments all while eating pizza? Well,  maybe a lot of things but this place IS really cool!   The pizza is decent for a pizza joint, lots of toppings to choose from and several specialty pizzas. There are also choices of appetizers, sandwiches and pastas available. I opted to add the salad bar which is your typical pizza place salad bar with a lot of toppings and a few side salad choices like potato and macaroni. All of the items were fresh and it was a nice addition to the pizza, however I wish it was offered for more than "one trip only". Beverages are ordered from a separate counter next to the salad bar which offers soda, beer and wine. Dessert is ice cream in a dish, cone or float, or go all out and get a sundae. Also remember to bring cash or check since it's all they accept (no plastic, but they have an ATM in lobby).   The entertainment is wonderful! The organist only talks a little bit between songs and the two times I've been there recently he played for a good 45 minutes to an hour before he took a break. He also sings happy birthday every set.   If you want to enjoy a different and unique place for dinner that includes entertainment definitely stop by!

Really cool atmosphere and definitely worth checking out if you want something fun and unique to do in the valley.   Came here a couple of weeks ago for the first time and it was Christmas in July! It was very fun to hear the organ play Christmas carols, Disney songs, Phantom of the Opera, etc. Definitely worth stopping in here for the experience!  I will say that the food is, well, not great. I would equate their pizza to high school cafeteria quality. We also had an order of onion rings which were just okay. Their ice cream sundae was tasty, but the options for creating it were limited.   I'd recommend coming here for a drink or two to listen to the Organ, but don't bother with the food.

We love Organ Stop! When you have friends and family visit this is a great place to bring them!  The pizza and salad bar are pretty good. Great, affordable entertainment. Kids love this place!  If you can, plan to arrive just as a set is ending. It might be easier to find the seat you want. The upper seating area offers a nice clear view of the whole room.  It is cash only. There is an ATM in the lobby.

Haven't been to Organ Stop in 30 years! Took my daughter and her friends for a fun girls night out and the tears were flowing.  This is a magical place - special to native Arizonans from the East Valley. Nothing has changed,  including the alley cat puppets dancing in the background.  I highly recommend to families looking for a fun and affordable night out.

I've grown up with Organ Stop, since they first opened at the location off of Dobson road. (they are no longer there but at Stapley and Southern now) Food and entertainment are always the best here and now I have children that love this place just as much as I have.  Thank you for over 30 years of good times!!

I'm giving Organ stop 4 stars purely because of the organ. I would give the food and service 2 stars. It's cash only and that's just silly but beyond that they have a separate line to order pizza and then to order drinks!  The food is so so but really it's all about the experience and not the food. Kids live it and a word to the wise- don't go at prime dinner time. There will be a ton of old people and no seats.

This place is unique with great pizza. Am having guests from Texas next week and this is #1 on the list. Music is beautiful. You've never seen such a magnificent layout of what this organ can produce. It's a one of a kind experience! Be sure to go!
Pizza not bad and live organ player. Had a good time. Will go agian.
The felt that the food at Organ Stop was just So-So! Nothing special! The Music there is great! You defiantly go to Organ Stop for the Organ! Not the Pizza!

I came here because of the teacher appreciation giveaway which was much appreciated. While the food was good and the atmosphere was nice...there were some minor annoyances. It seems like they really nickel and dime you to death. They don't take cards, so you have to use an ATM to get cash. The ATM charges a 2.50 fee. You have to buy your drink separately and you don't get free refills. $1.50 for a 16 oz glass is ridiculous. There just seems to be a lot of things most restaurants give their customers that these guys charge you for...doubt I'll be back.

The music makes the experience awesome! Pizza is good The salad bar is a must for 5.99 for a large salad it is a meal. The sundae bar is delicious I recommend the peach ice cream with chocolate sause whipped cream and nuts/ a dessert to die for :-) :-) :-) yum!! The one criticism is I didn't like their cheese bread A good night fun for the whole family I love listening to the mix of music/Disney,phantom,take me out to the ball game,star wars. Something everyone should experience at least once

Went to hear and see the pipe organ, drink some beer, eat some pizza, and have a good time. Heard about this place on YouTube. we are not disappointed. The performance was great (understatement), the mood was extremely happy, and othe pizza was better than expected. Drove from Las Vegas to check it out and was more than glad we did. If you're in Phoenix, you have to check this place out.

First time to visit this restaurant. Completely satisfied with the entertainment and the food was okay. Arrived about 5 o'clock ( the restaurant opens at 4 o'clock) and the line was was about 15 minutes on a Tuesday. Seating was a bit of a challenge however we managed to locate a table up stairs..  we'll definitely come back again.
Pizza....meh Music...holy crap amazing. Best nights are when they play the Star Wars Medley.  Pure heaven.  Take cash or a checkbook, they don't take credit cards or visa.

We thoroughly enjoyed the music - the whole set up for the organ is amazing! My five year old daughter sat entranced through most of the numbers played by the organist.   For food we ordered a pizza, a pasta dish, and trip to the salad bar.   The salad bar was ok. For the price that you pay for the salad bar they give a very small plate (dessert plate style). My wife always gets her dressing on the side, but there was no small cup to do this. There were no employees in the area so she had to settle for dressing on the salad.   The pizza we ordered was a take on a Hawaiian pizza (we do pepperoni instead of ham). The pizza was good, but the crust was weird (very heavy feel to it).   My daughter wanted spaghetti and meatballs. She enjoyed it immensely. We wish that they offered kid size portions (kid's menu). She left half of the spaghetti due to being full. Unfortunately our hotel did not have a refrigerator, so we ended up wasting half the plate.   They also offer ice cream for dessert. There is a wide range of flavors offered. The ice cream was very creamy and no ice crystals.   We would definitely come back for the entertainment and dessert.

This place is a must visit if in the Phoenix area. The Wurlitzer organ is amazing including the multiple other instruments it controls around the room, very cool experience. The pizza is really good too. The set up provides maximum turn over. Walk in and up to the pizza counter to order food and pay and get a number. Go around to the side to order drinks and pay. Go to the end and buy Ice cream if you want it. Find a seat, watch the number board for your food and enjoy the show. No hostess or waiter just busers. Just FYI they do not take credit cards. Cash and check only.

Had a very fun time here tonight with my family & friends my two year old loved the music and lights and actually sat and watched while he ate his pizza. Kinda hard to talk to your neighbor while the music was playing but that's quite alright, can't wait to go back. Been waiting a long time to come here and I'm so glad I did, my son will love to come back as well. A++   The pizza wasn't all that great reminded me of Peter Piper Pizza or of the like but it wasn't horrible, you pay for the music really.. I did love the ice cream though, Butter Pecan was great.  Like I said, can't wait to come back :-)   ALSO! BRING CASH NO DEBIT OR CREDIT! ATM charges 2.50 for deduct :-(
Love this place! Pizza was really good and music was out of this world. Will go back for sure.

We love this place! We saw Brett Valiant perform for the first time, and it was amazing! He pulled out all the stops, for sure! Our pizza was pretty darn good, too. The beer, well... We enjoy craft beers and tried a pitcher of Founders, but it was rather flat or wimpy for an IPA. But that won't stop us from returning! Organ Stop Pizza is THE reason we look forward to visiting the greater Phoenix area each year.

It was a great place to go to as far as watching the organ player and listening to the music.  The pizza on the other hand is nothing special at all.  It tasted like a frozen Digiornio pizza.  I would probably order pasta next time.  Pretty expensive too.  They only accept cash or checks.  No debit or credit cards.  You have to purchase your food and your drinks in two separate areas.  You have to pick up your food and carry it to your table.  No servers just bus people.  Iced tea they gave us free refills but pop you have to pay for refills.

Really fun place to eat!  We went on a Tuesday night around 6:30pm and we enjoyed it so much that we stayed until they closed at 9pm!  It was pretty busy but there were still plenty of open tables.  My 4 year old and my nieces and nephews (ages 1, 3, and 5) really enjoyed the music and the lights.  The gentleman playing the organ is simply amazing!  He played a huge variety of music- everything from the Beatles to Michael Jackson to Sinatra to Disney songs.  You can even request songs by filling out a request card and all of our requests were played :)  They serve pizza, a few other Italian dishes (I think I saw lasagna and spaghetti), and sandwiches or you can purchase a one time trip to their salad bar.  We had the pizza and it good.  We also made a trip to their ice cream counter for dessert.  They have about 15 different flavors and you can choose a cone, a dish, or a sundae.  They are definitely generous with the ice cream!  We got the one scoop cones but you'd think we ordered 2 or 3 scoops they were so big!  One thing to note- they do not accept credit or debit cards- only cash (and maybe checks??).  Overall a great time and we will definitely be back!
AMAZING SERVICE !!!!! We love Dustin he was such an angel!! We could tell he loves his job and genuinely cares for his customers. I am definitely coming back just for him.

Love the organ...  Sad to see this Arizona historical treasure in such danger of mediocrity due to poor management.  The pizza we had wasn't worth taking home.  I didn't want to insult the cardboard box by putting pizza in it that is more tasteless than  itself.  Fix yer food folks!!!

Amazing must see place. Live entertainment and the organ wall is just so cool. I didn't like how it was crowded after only an hour after opening for dinner but its just that popular. I'm sure the food was good but we couldn't find a place to sit and the lines look long for drinks and food too and I didn't see servers

An incredible display of musical instruments from the massive organ pipes to pianos, accordions, xylophones, drums, dancing puppets and bubbles playing beloved and popular songs old and new.  I grew up with this place when it was first in central Phoenix.  The pizza and appetizers are excellent and so is the salad bar drinks and desserts.  The place is a cultural icon with some of the best talent ever.
This rating is for the food!! Our pizza was so-so. The organist is awesome & I recommend you come for the music/experience. I give the organist FIVE STARS!!

This place is a classic.  The pizza's not all that great, to be honest, but the real attraction is the excellent, kitschy bit of old Americana you're seeing.  Organ Stop's players probably play the same sets of songs with the same effects that they were doing 20 years ago.  It's almost a rule that you have to hear Moon River, Chattanooga Choo Choo, and Alley Cat at least once.  I don't think this place ever really seems to change.  It's a Phoenix treasure and another cool example of the quirky stuff you can find in Mesa if you know where to look!

You don't really go to Organ Stop for the pizza.  The organ is fun (especially for Grandma and Grandpa - as well as kids).    Ordering is a bit of an adventure - cattle call ordering line where they give you a number and you come back in another line to pick up your food.  There is also a third line because you can not order your drinks (soda, beer and wine) in the line where you order your pizza.  The pizza is made on a chain belt and is average at best.  I was pleasantly surprised by the lasagna I ordered and the spaghetti looked good but I didn't try it.  The real star of Organ Stop is the organ and the man who plays it.  It may sound corny but it is fun and it is a hoot to see the older gentlemen stand up and salute when they play "Anchors Away", "Nothing can beat the US Air Corp or "The Halls of Montazuma"  In Summary  - average pizza, above average entertainment - worth taking your parents or grandparents to when they visit the Valley!

Organ Stop Pizza is good for two things...organ music and pizza!    I know that sounds rather obvious from the name, but if you want to experience the body-shaking power of the world's largest Wurlitzer pipe organ while you eat a great tasting slice of pie at one of the oldest businesses in Mesa, this is the place for you!  There's really not much else to draw one in here.  I mean, it's not in the "best" part of town, the interior dcor is well dated and the establishment is generally showing its age.    However, the power and complexity of the organ music is something that can only be experienced first-hand and the food, although a little pricey once you start stacking on toppings and drinks, keeps the great tastes and smells of a classic pizza house alive.    There is plenty of room for groups and events and it's not uncommon to have multiple birthday parties going on at once!  I believe private rooms are available, as well.    I will say that, when there are a bunch of children, it can get really loud and busy, but it's also the children's energy that helps make this place fun!   For those who want to sit back and relax, there are usually quieter spaces upstairs with great views of the organ.    If you're in the area and want to do something unique for a family dinner or birthday party, Organ Stop Pizza is a Phoenix-area classic that everyone should visit at least once!
Literally the worst pizza I have ever eaten. Cardboard with flavorless sauce and cheap cheese.  Just terrible. I ordered 2 pies and returned 1 of them.  DO NOT GO HERE FOR THE PIZZA

What a treasure! I love this place regardless of the mediocre or bad reviews. Who can say no to good music, wonderful light displays, and tasty pizza? It's a great place to keep everybody entertained! They have a little game room for the kiddos and  ice cream for us adults ;). BTW- FYI, bring cash. Only cash is accepted and while, there is an ATM machine, a processing fee is charged. Also the restaurant could get a bit crowded during the weekends, but hey, it's worth it!

Your experience is almost completely dependent on who's playing the organ on any given night.  If you have the misfortune of Charlie Balogh, it's your own fault because you should have checked the schedule before you went.  You will more than likely hear songs composed no later than 1968 which is fine if you're between 75-100 years old.  While there's a box for requests, it might as well lead to a paper shredder because Charlie prefers to play whatever he wants to hear or perhaps only what he knows how to play.  Try to keep requests simple and maybe they might get played, Mary Had a Little Lamb, Pop Goes the Weasel, etc.

You pay for the atmosphere more than the food. The food isn't the best but they do offer a gluten free option and I was able to bring dairy free cheese which they gladly put on my pizza for me. The music is loud and it is very hard to converse with other people in your party but it is a great show and they play lots of songs that most of us would know. We were able to sing along and have a great time. They also periodically had a bubble machine going so our kids loved that! Overall a great experience! It is a must try and a great tourist attraction. If you can wait to go until after 7, that is best because most of the older crowd and early dinner guests will have cleared out, resulting in more room and space to sit down.

This is a one of a kind, must see experience where you will hear very well played organ music and eat pizza!  What a clever combination.  The Organ Stop packs them in and people love it!  Kids dance, people stand up with their hands on their heart during their National Anthem (I heard THE STAR SPANGLED BANNER and O CANADA), and the music produces a resounding cacophony from all directions.    The organists who play here are well trained, experienced theater organists who can bring their preprogrammed beats and effects right into the song.  They take requests but obviously, not every request can be met.  The last time we were here, the music ranged from THRILLER to THE BATTLE HYMN OF THE REPUBLIC to THE SOUND OF MUSIC MEDLEY and more.  All were fantastic!!  The pizza is good too.  Add a $5 pitcher of soda and a salad from the salad bar and you're on your way to a great night out.  There's also appetizers and ice cream available.  We like to sit on the second level so we can see the revolving stage better.  I LOVE THIS PLACE

Love to bring the family here! The only things I have an issue with is they don't take credit cards and some times it can take a while to get your pizza. The credit card thing i can understand a few years ago because having a credit card processor can be a hassle and it take money from the business... but its 2017 now. With things like PayPal Here and Square there really shouldn't be an reason you don't take credit and debit cards. as far as pizza time that can all depend on how busy it is. would still recommend this to people coming into town and for families.

This is a great place to take the kids for pizza and entertainment when you're sick of the stagnant Chuck E Cheese's franchise.  Their pizza, though not great, is better than most of the kid-oriented pizza places in town, and they offer more options on the menu (including alcoholic beverages for the grown-ups!).    The main attraction is the giant Wurlitzer organ in the middle of the large, two-story dining room.  I like the fact that the entertainment is included in the price of your meal, and it's actual LIVE entertainment - the organists even take audience requests.  I went with my fiance and his almost-5-year-old in December, when about 75% of the songs are holiday songs.  I recommend sitting on the second floor, where you get a great view of the organist and an up-close look at a variety of the instruments.    After about an hour, the organ music can become a little too much, but at that point, you'll be done with your meal and on your way out the door.  This is a definite must-see place for anyone with kids or out-of-town visitors, especially during the holiday season!

We finally made our way across town to Organ Stop and the drive was totally worth it! The organist is amazing! He does the music all by memory, even the requests. The room alone is pretty cool with all the different instruments to compliment the organ. From Disney to Star Wars to Classical Pieces, my entire family (ages 1-65 years old) enjoyed the experience. They released bubbles during the Little Mermaid's "Under the Sea" which, of course, the kids loved! I'm not sure why people are griping about the pizza though. We thought that the pizza was exceptional and we're pretty picky about our pizzas! We ordered a couple regulars as well as a gluten free pizza for my mom and it was easily the best GF pizza we've had anywhere in the valley (go figure!!) 3 large pizzas plus a small order of fries that was actually quite large, ran about $50, fed 6 adults, 2 kids and provided ample leftovers. It would definitely be cheaper if you're not needing gluten free.  Sure, it's slightly annoying that they only take cash but they do have an ATM in the lobby if you don't plan ahead. The water tasted terrible. (Maybe that's just a City of Mesa thing?) so bring your own or just buy a pitcher of soda for $5.  Aside from those 2 negs., I would definitely recommend Organ Stop and I will most definitely return!

this is the best place everrrrr! im definitely coming here again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again and again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

OMG I TOTALLY loved this place. First time. It was fantastic. What a awesome concept. The organ player was phenomenal. I may never go again because it is pretty far from my house but I am so glad my sister convinced me to go. I am sure that organ playing is a lost art. Cross that off my bucket list! So worth the trip! And the food was pretty decent too. I totally did not expect that!

Food was okay... pretty standard pizza but the ambience well worth your visit.  The organ is breathtaking.  The musician was extremely talented and played a wide range of different music.  There are lights, bubbles, a disco ball, and puppets.  This is definitely somewhere you want to bring out of town guests.  I've heard the weekends are insanely busy.  We came on a Wednesday night during the summer and didn't have to worry about long waits or no seats. They do not except cards so be sure to bring cash.  Prices are definitely reasonable I was surprised there was no cover charge but I'm used to California Where they charged you arm and leg for everything

Have enjoyed Organ Stop Pizza for decades - since it was on 7th St & Missouri in Phoenix.  It is a fantastic place for family celebrations or just a fun spot to go relax, enjoy the organ entertainment and have really great pizza.  The pizza is some of the best I've eaten - has always been great.  Hot fudge sundaes are also yummy!  The only downside is that they are cash only - however, when you know that, it is not a downside.  They have a very successful business model and I for one am a loyal fan.  Keep up that great work, Organ Stop Pizza!

This was my first time here and will probably be my last time here too.  I will admit that it was a cool place to go to and see the biggest organ in the world.    The restaurant is two stories; they only take cash or checks for food and drinks. When the organ plays the lights go out and you cannot see your food that you are eating.  :(  Also luckily I had cash that night to pay for our food and drinks.    Well it was a cool place to go to and see the organ playing.  If the lights stayed on all the time I would probably give it another try.

It's Chucky Cheese for grown ups.  A huge , beautiful Wurlitzer fills the room with incredibly rich music and fidelity.  Songs seemed centered on the 50's and Broadway-sound of music, Music Man, etc.  Enjoyable,but a conversation killer.  So come to listen & eat.  The pizza is slightly above average.  We had a gluten free veggie & spicy meat pizza. The crust was surprisingly good and there was more cheese & toppings than average.  A little more sauce & it might have gotten 5 stars.  The organist takes breaks throughout the afternoon and evening.  Open at 4...Early enough for the blue hairs.  They close at 9pm. Note-no debit or credit.  Cash & checks only.  There's an ATM in the lobby if you're short cash.   And after your pizza you can add to the Caliries with an ice cream sundae.

Amazing, simply amazing.  I could not help but smile and enjoy the music.  Oh yeah, the pizza was good also.  We checked this place out for my son's eleventh birthday.  He loved all the different type of musical instruments hanging up from the walls to the ceiling.  Little did we know, we would be transported into a magical place where each instrument comes alive.  We sat in wonderment almost forgetting the pizza in front of us.  A must see!!!  An experience you'll appreciate!  LOVE IT!!

Different twist to a pizza place and is a fun experience, if you like organ music that is! Pizza was good. Seating isn't ideal especially when it's busy, dirty tables and squeezing together. Overall, still fun and would recommend trying!

Such a fun bit of Americana! A friend had his birthday celebration here and  I must say that it was quite the entertaining experience. Food's OK and not too badly priced, considering the entertainment that comes with it; and, $2 mugs of beer on tap ... yes!  The Wurlitzer was impressive: around 6000 pipes and 4 large turbine blowers make it one of the largest theater organs in the world. The pipes themselves, as well as accessory instruments - piano, percussion instruments, even a mechanical quacking duck - are scattered around the interior of the building and displayed and lit to become part of a grand light and sound show. I thoroughly enjoyed the organist's performance, which ranged from folk to pop (including adventure and sci-fi movie themes) to classical pieces. The performance ends with a sing-along.  Pretty much all ages are represented in the customer demographic, from toddlers to seniors, but leaning heavily toward family groups. Kids definitely love the place, as I saw many of them break away from their families to go beside the organ platform and spontaneously dance to the music.
Still the best dinner theater .Great for all ages .Very clean ,and nice .
Honestly, there's nothing like it. Old time music played on multiple organs. A sight to see and experience. It is loud. Food is....pizza. Simple mediocre pizza. But an experience to share.

So interesting! The organ is huge and it has many attachments. Music is very entertaining.  My 11 and 5 yrs old were very entertained! The pizza was good, and appetizers (garlic bread, garlic bread with cheese and mozzarella sticks). Their fruit punch pint was really good too!

When you review a place like Organ Stop, it is about so much more than the food. First point, you apparently have to get there when they open at 4 or you might not get seating for a while. We were visiting the in-laws in Sun City and were informed we would have to leave before 3 in order to get seating. Nothing like trying to go across Phoenix during rush hour for an early dinner.   When you get in, you can see that it is quite a display. A huge, colorful organ rises up on a dais and swivels back and forth while the organist plays. The organist is very talented and can play a wide variety of songs. There are small instruments on wall that play and even some puppets that periodically come out from behind a wall and dance. It is, like someone at the table next to ours described it, "Chuck E Cheese for old people".  When it comes to the food, the Chuck E Cheese comparison is pretty accurate. It really isn't anything special. Thank you to all the Yelpers who warned me about needing cash and about the separate food and drink lines. I suppose the separate lines makes some sense but the cash only is strange. Obviously, you go to a place like this for the entertainment, not the food. But, really, that only lasts so long. My 10 year old lasted about half an hour before clamoring for his iPad. I lasted only slightly longer. It's an interesting place to go to once but that might be about it.

So let me set the scene first, My church social group took a trip here last saturday. We are not your mothers church. The churhc is Community Church of Hope, We are the valleys largest GLBT church so when we desended upon Organ stop Pizza, in LDS land you know we look a little out of place. We had about 50 people from our church come and boy did we have fun.  There was a baptist church a couple rows down from us who didn't see it coming. Now we aren't a bunch of flamers frolicking around or anything but we do tend to get a little loud and generally have a great time. I did recognized some of the music  so I was able to sing along with those.  This is a great place to take anyone over 50.  I do think they might be washing dirtymob money or something since the business is cash only.........which I think caught a lot of people off guard including me.  The show starts at 530  so dont be late !!!!!!

Great pizza, great music, friendly and helpful staff. Awesome place for family, birthdays, anniversary, anything really! Be prepared for a fairly noisy environment due to large crowd that this great place brings!

Largest Wurlitzer pipe organ in the world with nearly 6000 pipes and valued at $5 million will "blow" you away.  Keep looking and you will discover more instruments playing.  Come for the pizza, soda and beer too.

I finally know the irony behind "Phoenix's most romantic restaurant." If you've ever had the pleasure of asking Yelp Talkers for a suggestion on where to take a first date, second date, anniversary date, valentines date, or date of any type where romance is foremost on your list - you may have incidentally ended up here dressed in your best duds. I fortunately, didn't fall into that particular trap, I did however, show up here cause a friend had some family in town and invited us all out to dine with her.  What fun, I thought, I'll finally get to see what all the hubbaloo is about, I finally get to experience romance at it's finest. Secretly, I never really checked the place out at all, I didn't read about it, I had no real clue as to what this place was. I always just assumed it was some weird mixture of pizza joint, strip club, and themed in hospital recovery room and left it at that.   Boy was I wrong, and not necessarily in a good way. I will say that this is certainly an experience, one that you'll not have anywhere else, in town or out of town, except maybe unless there's another organ stop pizza somewhere. Touting the worlds largest Wurlitzer pipe organ, the name finally makes sense. Organ has nothing to do with the male organ, nothing to do with greasy pizza stopping your organs as you eat it, nothing to do with stripping, boy was I wrong, but I'm still not sure if I was wrong in a good way or bad.  Either way you 'slice' it, the pizza here is less than mediocre, but the ambiance! The ambiance less than makes up for the mediocre pizza. The thrill of pipe organs lasts only so long, and I think I clocked it at about 3 minutes and 47 seconds, but the kids all seemed to love it. I guess if you've got kids, feel like seeing the worlds largest Wurlitzer in action and in all it's glory, then you know where to go this Friday.  So Phoenix Yelpers, I hope I left you with some insight into Organ Stop Pizza and hopefully you don't get trapped in the age old Phoenix Yelp Talk question of "Where's the most romantic place to take your girl?" because unwittingly, you'll be sent here.  Happy Yelping Phoenix!

Unbelievably fun! This place should br franchised.  Not on is it fun for the whole family, it's showcasing a seldom appreciated instrument, and amazing artista.  Everyone should see this, buy some pizza, and enjoy the experience!

Love the delicious personal-sized pizza at Organ Stop Pizza!!! It's just the right size and made fresh. The thin crust reminds me of Shakey's pizza. You can't beat the atmosphere either...Live entertainment on a Wurlitzer Organ!! Great, inexpensive evening out for the entire family! And don't miss their salad bar and yummy ice cream selection!
Two words: great music. I went there for the experience and music. Cool mix of veteran and kids. Always a surprise.
Great music and the pizza has gotten much better over the last few years. If you are looking for great entertainment for "kids of all ages" and quality pizza, this is the place.

Organ Stop Pizza is a childhood favorite of mine. We visited this location as well as the downtown Phoenix location before it for years. Now that I live in the far west valley, it's been, easily 10 years since I last visited OSP.  We happened to be in the neighborhood for a Convention so we brought a large group of friends to experience OSP themselves.  First things first, this place is visited by a lot of retirees. And by a lot I'd say that we were the youngest group there by at least 50 years...and the glares to the kids in our group did not go unnoticed. But our kids are all very well behaved despite the daggered looks from those who forget what it's like to have children.   Speaking of children, OSP is not very kid-friendly when it comes to certain areas that we apparently take for granted. There are no cups with lids on them at all. We were informed that they need to have a special 'license' for that from Pepsi. This is news to me as I've worked with Pepsi for years and know of no special license. The excuse was that they were afraid that people would take the kid cups, put alcoholic beverages in them and walk out of the restaurant. um...WHAT? Additionally, if you have a child who requires his pizza cut up into smaller pieces, good luck trying to find a knife there. There was 1 and I mean o-n-e (1) butter knife in the whole restaurant that we practically had to sign over our first born child in order to use. I'm pretty sure that the retirees aren't looking to shank each other in the parking lot so to have to play verbal judo with the staff to use a standard utensil was really ridiculous.  The restaurant is now cash-only. This means no debit or credit cards are taken but they conveniently have an ATM machine located in the lobby to not only dispense cash but charge a hefty $3 fee to use. If you want to have a refill on your drink, there is a charge for that too. Buying drinks by the pitcher is fine but it's soda...seriously? The pizza is alright, the salad bar is 1 trip only and is sparse at best.   The single saving grace of it all is the Organ. The piece de resistance. This is a good thing and a bad thing because given all that I've described, its simply not enough for me to drive an hour out of my way for an otherwise aggravating time between musical sets. While you're there, it makes those aggravating occurrences not quite so bad though because it's such a unique, memorable, interesting experience. I loved OSP as a child and enjoyed so many wonderful, memorable visits. Unfortunately, it's not always enough.

Wow. How to review this place?  The pizza is about 3/5, salad good but it's one trip with the tiniest plate ever. Their service is counter service only but the show was a kick. Not what we expected at all but we had fun. For that alone, we will probably come back. It was fun to watch the crowd get into it and clap along with the organ.

At first glance, I wanted to run far away from this place.  I went on a double date and it seemed so loud that we weren't going to be able to talk.  It was packed and there were long lines for ordering pizza.  Be advised CASH ONLY!!  After we ordered our pizza, we scouted out for a table.   If you are patient and wait for the groups to clear out after the music, then it is fairly easy to get a good seat.  All of the instruments around the place were really neat, and they light up when they are being played.  The pizza here was awesome too!!  So, the music that he played....Star Wars theme-which was my second favorite.  The best song though was Phantom of the Opera.  It was memorizing and I fell in love with Organ Stop Pizza at that moment.  I am sure that the man is tired of playing those songs over and over but he was in good spirits and played them with a smile.   I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to go somewhere different and doesn't mind crowds or loud music.  Hell, even if you don't like crowds or loud music (most of the time I don't) I would recommend this place!

The business model is as old as the organ!  If a business chooses not to take cards - I get it. I would love nothing but cash too with out merchant fees and tax reporting. But this could not be. Why? Because they take personal checks. So yeah, bring cash.   With such great entertainment for children and adults alike surely they have the food to match. The large cheese pizza cost 14 dollars and it tasted worse than a 5 dollar hot and ready from little caesars. The salad bar was a one pass and you had you had to pay for soda by the glass - at another cash register than the pizza order line. Ridiculous.

First of all, let's be clear that this is not the place to go if food is your priority!  Service is of the "do it yourself" variety, lines are long, pizza is "Chicago priced" at "frozen food aisle" quality, and they won't take a credit card! That being said, listening to a competent organist play "The Mighty Wurlitzer" is worth the aggravation.  Something to do at least once in your life!

OK. Imagine the Grand Canyon had ice cream. Not the best ice cream, but hey it's ice cream. Would you tell people, "Yeah I went to the grand canyon, but the ice cream was just alright. I don't know if I'd recommend it." If you would, take a run as fast as you can (head first) into a wall, come back and read this again.  No! The pizza isn't the best. But hey! It's pizzaI The Organ is what you are going for. Take your kids and anyone else you can pack into your car and go. Have a day!

My family and I love organ stop pizza! It's such a fun environment, and the organ is so beautiful! The pizza is average (but i also don't like pizza that much), but going to listen to the organ is the real show! It's just a fun place to hang out and enjoy friends and family! :)

CASH ONLY, PRICEY, LEAVE IT FOR THE TOURIST! Some friends wanted to eat here, because their senior parents love this place and would be dining with us. So we met friends and senior parents here for pizza. Let me just say this was not my thing.   CRAZY setup, you wait in a line and order your pizza. Then you go wait in a second line to order your beverages (paying separately). Then go sit at school cafeteria tables, in a VERY crowded, VERY loud dining room. Can't talk to anyone, the music is deafening. Packed WALL TO WALL with senior citizens. Which explains the taste.  Now I've had Chicago style, New York style, and even California style pizza. But this pizza is Nursing Home-Hospital style pizza; it's not good, taste a little better than a frozen Red Baron.  Organ music is good, would be better if not SO loud. Would be better if you only waited in one line for food and drinks and paid for them together. If these two things were different, I'd say worth a trip in for nostalgic reasons. Oh and it's CASH ONLY. So stop by the atm and pull out plenty, it's also pricey!!!

Tonight was our second and likely final visit to Organ Stop. After going for the first time a few weeks ago (and leaving a glowing review on their facebook page) we were eagerly anticipating taking our family back. When we went in tonight, nearly every table on the main floor was dirty and full of dishes. Had a health inspector walked in, they would have likely been shut down on the spot. When we asked the counter staff to have some tables bussed we were told that "someone would be by". When the bussers finally arrived they seemed to move in slow motion, and did a poor job, and seemed annoyed when we asked them to wipe off the table properly. When my fiance expressed our displeasure to the "assistant manager" he nodded blankly and did not apologize. If you value your family's health, I would suggest not going in there until they clean up their act. The organ player and pizza were both good.  I will try to post photos of all of the dirty tables.

This is not your typical place to go out to dinner. They have a huge organ that a very skilled organist plays about a 15 to 20 minute set of music requests every hour or so.  Not my first choice for a dinner with family, but they were from out of town and my sister is a music major. Needless to say she loved it. The food is ok.. Nothing to write home about, but you aren't there for the food -you're there to hear the music! Lots of kids lots of seating- I think it it would be hectic if we went on a weekend- we went on a Thursday and seating was easy to find for a group of 5.

My two stars is for the food and ordering process.  I still thing going to the restaurant to experience the organ and bring friends or visitors is a must.  They only accept cash or check and that is always inconvenient.  Very few places don't take debit cards and I contantly have to remind myself to go to the bank on our way to Organ Stop.  You wait in line to order your food and it bothers me that I can't get mushrooms on only 1/4 of the pizza.  Toppings are only done in 1/2.  After you pay for your food you wait in a new line to get your drinks.  Frustrating!!!  The pizza is not even worth eating, IMO.
